alert.note: Alert for Greene; Lawrence; Monroe; Owen (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 7:49AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Indiana, southwest Indiana and west central Indiana, including the following counties, in south central Indiana, Lawrence and Monroe. In southwest Indiana, Greene. In west central Indiana, Owen. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 749 AM EDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bloomington, Bloomfield, Worthington, Solsberry, Whitehall, Harrodsburg, Smithville, Indiana University, Fairfax State Recreation Area, Monroe Reservoir, Bartlettsville, Freedom, Charles Deam Wilderness and Heltonville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
